g.text: Safety Curtains: Still nothing. No one's home.
Kim Kitsuragi: "In any case, there's no way we can get in right now. Let's investigate further."
Safety Curtains: An iron safety curtain curves before your eyes, folded like a bellows. It covers half the room -- blocking the way into a colossal industrial chimney.
Logic: If this is really an entrance to the chimney then there must be a furnace somewhere as well. Maybe there's another way to get in?
Physical Instrument: There must be another way to wake up whoever is in there... Maybe you should try yelling into the furnace downstairs?
Kim Kitsuragi: The lieutenant sighs. "Ghosts aren't real, didn't your parents tell you that? In any case, there's no way we can get in right now. Let's investigate further."
You: "I need to find the *malignant entity*, Kim. This is the chimney."
Safety Curtains: As before, an iron safety curtain curves before your eyes. It covers half the room -- blocking the way into a colossal industrial chimney.
Kim Kitsuragi: "Why do you think there's something on the other side necessarily?" the lieutenant asks, but you can see a spark of curiosity in his eyes.
Safety Curtains: What an odd thing to do.... Nothing happens.
Inland Empire: This must be where the *Entity* lives...
You: "This is not random, this is *significant*. I want to see what's on the other side."
Kim Kitsuragi: "There must be another way to wake up whoever is in there... Maybe we should ask the lady in the bookstore what's going on here?"
You: "I can try..." (Blow gently on your bruised knuckles.)
Safety Curtains: Again your voice becomes a raspy croak, mid-sentence. It's silent in the abandoned office building -- no one answers you.
Empathy: A sudden bout of self pity comes over you.
Safety Curtains: Those curtains prove to be surprisingly sturdy... Your fist hurts now.
Kim Kitsuragi: "There must be another way to wake up whoever is in there... Maybe we can try yelling into the furnace downstairs?"
Drama: Sire, may we suggest something? Think of the yelling-into-the-furnace as a *grand performance*. Use your chest voice, not your head voice. Sing from the diaphragm.
Kim Kitsuragi: "Can you please try to refrain from attacking random things?"
Logic: This is directly above the central furnace in the cellar. The voices probably came from here.
Physical Instrument: You took your shot and still missed. Well, you did your best, champ. Shame it wasn't good enough.
Logic: There must be another way to wake up whoever is in there... Maybe you should talk to the lady in the bookstore, ask what's going on?
You: "Hello? I yelled, but it didn't work..."
Physical Instrument: Perhaps it's not such a bad idea? Try it again, son.
